title: Beyoncé’s “Cowboy Carter” Tour Kicks Off — With Cheap Tickets Still Available
description: Tickets for many dates on Queen Bey's "COWBOY CARTER" tour are currently going for well below face value. Beyoncé’s “Cowboy Carter” Tour Kicks Off — With Cheap Tickets Still Available Scoop Harrison
author: Scoop Harrison
excerpt: Tickets for many dates on Queen Bey's "COWBOY CARTER" tour are currently going for well below face value.
text: A recent viral reddit thread suggested Beyoncé tickets now “cost less than a Happy Meal.” While that’s not entirely accurate, tickets to the Los Angeles kickoff and other dates on Queen Bey’s “COWBOY CARTER” tour are currently going for well below face value on secondary platforms. At last check on StubHub, tickets for Monday night’s show at SoFi Stadium can be found for as low as $55 (fees included) for seats in the 500 sections. Seats in the 300 sections are going for as low as $136, while seats in the 100 sections available for as low as $219. Meanwhile, floor seats are available for between $600 and $700 at present. Similarly priced tickets are available for Beyoncé’s other upcoming concerts at SoFi on Thursday, May 1st; Sunday, May 4th; Wednesday, May 7th; and Friday, May 9th. After her run of shows in Los Angeles, Beyoncé will then bring the “COWBOY CARTER” tour to Chicago, East Rutherford, NJ, Houston, Washington, DC, Atlanta, and Las Vegas. It’s hard to pinpoint exactly why Beyoncé is struggling to sell out her “COWBOY CARTER” tour, especially following the massive success of her recent “RENAISSANCE” run and her new tour’s namesake winning Album of the Year at the Grammys. Most likely, it’s a combination of factors, from a cooling economy to high initial ticket prices to the post-COVID surge in concert demand finally leveling off. Beyoncé isn’t alone, either — based on Ticketmaster seat maps, major acts ranging from Post Malone to Linkin Park also have plenty of tickets left for their upcoming tours. Beyonce’s “COWBOY CARTER” Tour Dates: 04/28 – Inglewood, CA @ SoFi Stadium (Get Tickets) 05/01 – Inglewood, CA @ SoFi Stadium (Get Tickets) 05/04 – Inglewood, CA @ SoFi Stadium (Get Tickets) 05/07 – Inglewood, CA @ SoFi Stadium (Get Tickets) 05/09 – Inglewood, CA @ SoFi Stadium (Get Tickets) 05/15 – Chicago, IL @ Soldier Field (Get Tickets) 05/17 – Chicago, IL @ Soldier Field (Get Tickets) 05/18 – Chicago, IL @ Soldier Field (Get Tickets) 05/24 – East Rutherford, NJ @MetLife Stadium (Get Tickets) 05/25 – East Rutherford, NJ @MetLife Stadium (Get Tickets) 05/25 – East Rutherford, NJ @MetLife Stadium (Get Tickets) 05/29 – East Rutherford, NJ @MetLife Stadium (Get Tickets) 06/28 – Houston, TX @ NRG Stadium (Get Tickets) 06/29 – Houston, TX @ NRG Stadium (Get Tickets) 07/04 – Washington, DC @ Northwest Stadium (Get Tickets) 07/05 – Washington, DC @ Northwest Stadium (Get Tickets) 07/10 – Atlanta, GA @ Mercedes-Benz Stadium (Get Tickets) 07/11 – Atlanta, GA @ Mercedes-Benz Stadium (Get Tickets) 07/13 – Atlanta, GA @ Mercedes-Benz Stadium (Get Tickets) 07/14 – Atlanta, GA @ Mercedes-Benz Stadium (Get Tickets) 07/25 – Las Vegas, NV @ Allegiant Stadium (Get Tickets) 07/26 – Las Vegas, NV @ Allegiant Stadium (Get Tickets)
html:
A recent viral reddit thread suggested Beyoncé tickets now “cost less than a Happy Meal.” While that’s not entirely accurate, tickets to the Los Angeles kickoff and other dates on Queen Bey’s “COWBOY CARTER” tour are currently going for well below face value on secondary platforms.

At last check on StubHub, tickets for Monday night’s show at SoFi Stadium can be found for as low as $55 (fees included) for seats in the 500 sections. Seats in the 300 sections are going for as low as $136, while seats in the 100 sections available for as low as $219. Meanwhile, floor seats are available for between $600 and $700 at present.

Similarly priced tickets are available for Beyoncé’s other upcoming concerts at SoFi on Thursday, May 1st; Sunday, May 4th; Wednesday, May 7th; and Friday, May 9th.

After her run of shows in Los Angeles, Beyoncé will then bring the “COWBOY CARTER” tour to Chicago, East Rutherford, NJ, Houston, Washington, DC, Atlanta, and Las Vegas.

It’s hard to pinpoint exactly why Beyoncé is struggling to sell out her “COWBOY CARTER” tour, especially following the massive success of her recent “RENAISSANCE” run and her new tour’s namesake winning Album of the Year at the Grammys. Most likely, it’s a combination of factors, from a cooling economy to high initial ticket prices to the post-COVID surge in concert demand finally leveling off. Beyoncé isn’t alone, either — based on Ticketmaster seat maps, major acts ranging from Post Malone to Linkin Park also have plenty of tickets left for their upcoming tours.
